headline: Easy Homemade Pasta Dough
description: This pasta dough recipe makes quick-and-easy, homemade dough for pasta, like ravioli and linguine, with 5 simple ingredients in less than 30 minutes.
name: Easy Homemade Pasta Dough

recipeInstructions.text: Mix flour, eggs, olive oil, and salt in a bowl until combined. Add water, 1 teaspoon at a time, to flour mixture until a smooth, thick dough forms.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured work surface and knead for 10 minutes. Let dough rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
Divide dough into 8 balls; use a pasta machine to roll and cut dough into desired pasta shape.

review.reviewBody: I did it with my grandchildren and her friends...first time pasta makers and it was perfecto
good recipe but needs more rest time at least 30 min an hour better
My go-to recipe for pasta in my Kitchen Aid mixer. Works great every time.

I too was (shamefully) out of olive oil, veggy worked fine. Needed all the water but no more. This was our first time as the machine was opened Christmas morning 2022. I had strong doubts about the dough but the press removed all concerns. These are delicious noodles! We are going to experiment with supplementing various flours including gluten-free.

Noodles turned out curiously, to say the least. We didn't have a pasta machine, which likely caused the problem. So we turned them into churros instead and baked them at 400 degrees for 7 minutes. Delicious!

It's very hard to find recipes for things like pasta that render a small amount, and this is perfect for one meal for two people. I paired it with the Alfredo Sauce recipe by Rebecca Swift here on AR and it was sooooo delicious and incredibly filling. I have a Kitchenaid with all three pasta rollers/cutters and it was a breeze to run them though..I even use the roller to knead the dough for me util it comes out smooth. A keeper because this is very easy to make in just a few minutes and doesn't produce five pound of pasta to be forgotten about later.

This was easy and tasty. Just remember to keep the dough moist that you're not using. I used a damp paper towel to keep scraps damp until I could preroll them into pasta. It was perfect for big raviolis, but a little dry for fettuccine. Would add more egg for fettuccine or noodles.
Best flavor ever, this is a keeper
I have used this same recipe for the past 40 yrs handed down to me by my mother
Good and easy to make
This made good ravioli.
I love this recipe. The more I make it the better it turns out. Once in awhile when intake it I like to add some garlic juice.

This is an excellent, quick-to-make dough - I do use 00 flour, but all other ingredients the same. I mix the ingredients with my kitchen aid mixer then switch to the dough hook to knead. I let it rest for 20-30 minutes before rolling and cutting. I’ve used this to make fettuccini and tortellini, and plan to make spaghetti tonight.
The dough itself was fine but as another reviewer commented it tasted eggy.
Easy and delicious! Either as linguine, paperdell or ravioli!
Turns out perfect pasta. I did use garlic olive oil because I love garlic.
I am a chef and I think this is awesome
First time making homemade pasta. I followed the recipe and loved it. I used my Kitchenaid attachments I got on black Friday. Next time I am going to experiment and maybe add spinach. Thanks!!!
loved it! I used 1 cup semolina and 1 cup ap flour.. Perfect eveyrone loved it. Will be my fav recipe from now on. So simple
Perfect dough!
Easy and good. Made
it is great
This recipe was incredibly simple and worked perfectly! This was my first time making pasta and it could not have been easier. Can't wait to do it again!

Thanks my pasta turned out prefect! i and my children where so excited! I have always wanted to make my own pasta. I did it and LORD it is great! Yes we are up at 3:00am in the morning eating fresh homemade pasta! lol

Used 1cup regular flour and 1 cup semolina, which I keep in the freezer. Mixed and kneaded by putting it all in the KA on 3 for about 10 minutes. Looked scrappy. Put in ziplock bag and let it rest about 30 min while making sauce. Then froze half and rolled half through pasta machine 2 times on 1, folding between rolls, once on 3,5,and7, no folds. Cut with fettuccine rollers. Forgot to flour but no sticking. Cooked up perfectly!
Wow, made this last night with an Avocado Carbonara sauce and it was amazing. Can't wait to try this with "00" flour.

The dough comes together nicely. In less than an hour, we have wonderful homemade pasta that is delicious. And, making this recipe has proven to be a great activity for my 6 YO daughter and me to do together. When we made the last batch, we dyed pink at her request. Why not? :-(
Worked great! Really tasty. Thanks!! A+
I didn't end up needing to use water and dough was a touch sticky but still worked when dusted with flour before rolling and cutting. But pasta tasted a bit too eggy
Easy to make. I will make it again.
Great recipe, my grandma made pasta in a well of flour and mixed and kneaded to complete the dough for noodles! Mixer did a nice job and saved time! I will use this dough recipe again and again! Ty
Easy recipe. Great noodles when done! I made fettuccine.
Made it just as is, and it turned out great! Now I'll never want store bought again!
It came out great! Being my first try I was amazed at how well it worked!
LOVED IT!
I’ve tried a lot of pasta recipes in the past, but this is, by far, the best I’ve made!

So quick and easy. It was my first time ever making homemade pasta as I’ve always been nervous to try it out. I used my KA Stand Mixer for the mixing and kneading and then made fettuccini with a manual pasta machine. My husband, whose mother has been making homemade pasta all her life, said mine was just as good as hers....if that doesn’t say it all I don’t know what does. :) I will make this again and again!

This recipe is amazing! The only to change is to leave them out to dry before boiling them. This only takes 10-15 minutes. Put them on a cookie sheet with a little flour. Once they are dry, you can boil them.
Very good enjoyed the pasta

I needed this to remind me of the proportions. I use the KitchenAid pasta machines. The recipe turned everything out to be perfect. For those of you interested in trying homemade pasta but don’t have a pasta machine try pasta rustica. Just make the pasta door rolling out as flat as you can and then roll it up and cut it as thin as you can and then unroll the pieces and boil them. You will be amazed at the results and people will be very impressed.
I made and next time I am going to only make four dough balls instead of eight
Easy and good. Grandchild wanted to make rainbow pasta. Added food coloring.
Easy and quick to make . The family loves it more than the normal dried pasta you buy at the store.
it turned out great! i will be making this again. :)
Worked out great!
Delicious..we used wheat flour!
Great pasta. I used 1 cup semolina and 1 cup of regular flour. Just enough for the two of us!
Added fresh basil and minced garlic.
Works great (make sure to add flour so noddles don’t stick)
Amazing and easy. I added an extra yolk. Use the dough to make raviolis. Yummy. This is my new pasta recipe. Thank you for sharing.
So easy and great! I used all-purpose flour and semolina flour (equal parts) instead of just all-purpose flour.
I used as direction, sub water with tomato juice, used 1 tsp. garlic oil sub for part of olive oil, awsome...
First time making pasta with the kitchen aid pasta attachment - came out great and was super easy!
First time making pasta with the kitchen aid pasta attachment - came out great and was super easy!

Nice pasta recipe. Didn’t feel like getting my pasta machine out so I mixed, rolled out with rolling pin & cut into strips with my pizza cutter. Made great noodles for our chicken & noodles dinner. My husband kept commenting on how good these were. Thanks for posting your recipe.
So easy and so good!

I found this very easy to work with. The only change that I made was using "00" flour, just as I usually do. Well, two changes actually, I didn't knead the dough, I never do because I let the KA do the work. I set the dial to #3 and put each portion through several times, folding it in on itself each time. I then set the dial to #5 and put it through once, then use the fettuccine cutter.Perfect pasta, thanks for the recipe.
Very easy and absolutely delicious pasta.

I used “00” flour and it is as good as the Italian restaurant that inspired me to make my own pasta. The “00” flour makes it taste more fresh and soft! My husband said he never had any pasta this good.
I omit the water and add an additional egg to add creaminess to the pasta. it always has great bite, and every now and then I add tumeric for a rich yellow color. my picky wife eats it right up.
Yummy. We made squash and cream cheese ravioli with it, and straight up boiled pasta squares... my son's request.
Great pasta.
I made it into dumpling like shapes and it's a little rubbery but it tastes good

Easy to make, but very hard to roll out. 
Thank you for the recipe.

I have used a few different pasta recipes and this was hands-down the best and easiest. I did use dill-flavored olive oil instead of plain and that may have made a bit of difference but the general consensus was - A-mazing. Thank you
Turned out great only change I made was the flour, I used semolina flour.
I followed the recipe as written. With the Kitchenaid pasta attachment to flatten the dough. There was enough to slice spaghetti and linguini. Even my picky eating kids liked them! Delicious!!
It was quick and easy. Our first time making it and would def do again.
Made lasagna noodles out of the dough, didn't precook and it turned out perfectly! I want to try it again and make spaghetti or fettuccine
Thank you for this awesome recipe made it last week for the first time and pasta turned out so good my family loved it... Hurray I can make my own pasta
Really simple and delicious! Thank you for sharing!
This came out great! The dough was so soft and smooth and the pasta came out amazing, will definitely continue making homemade pasta
Did not make any changes. Used dough to make the best ravioli!
This recipe is super easy and the pasta was fabulous. I always thought people who said homemade pasta tastes better we're making that up but now I'm a believer!!! I really can taste the difference.
Super easy and quick to prepare. First time I made from scratch, using a pasta maker everyone loved it. This will be my go to from now on.

What a great, easy recipe! I love mixing the dough bowl. It is so cleaner and easier. Also, the pasta (fettucini) took a little over one minute to cook in pre-boiling water. It was per and delicious! It was enough pasta for two generous entrees or appetizer portions.
Followed almost to the T, used half whole flour and half white... came out wonderful. The end product was raviollis. Turned out perfect.
First time pasta maker here! So easy! I'll use this forever.
Made this the other night and the kids loved it. My wife even loved it. Lol. I made a dairy free Alfredo to go with it and it all came out awesome.
First time trying to make pasta. My picky hubby loved it!!! It was pretty easy and now I'm wondering why I've ever bought pasta.

I followed the directions as written and used the dough to make spinach/mushroom ravioli and it was perfect! The consistency of this dough worked well with my KitchenAid pasta attachments--much better than the pasta recipe that comes with the gadgets! Will use for all my homemade pasta recipes! Thanks for sharing.
Easy dough to make. This is my sixth time making it and I got a little adventurous and added garlic infused oil, and it has upped the flavor. Great for first time pasta makers!
Came out perfect. I am not a great cook ,just ask my kids, but this pasta was easy and tasted delicious
I used AP flour, it worked well. It was so easy, I put all the ingredients in my mixer and it whipped right up! I hardly needed any water.

Very easy pasta recipe with great results. This is my new go to pasta recipe. I used 00 flour, but I imagine AP would work just as well. I didn't have time to let the egg come to room temperature and the pasta still came out perfectly.
Easy peasy...worked great

Made this tonight without the machine, just rolled out by hand for ravioli's. Despite my husbands doubt the whole family loved it! Hooray I can make my own pasta!!! Also I used regular old vegetable oil as i was out of olive oil. Was wonderful!
This recipe never fails to yield easy, quick fresh pasta!
